info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 1 at 8:41PM MDT until August 1 at 11:45PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
FFWABQ
The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... South Central San Miguel County in northeastern New Mexico...
* Until 1145 PM MDT.
* At 841 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 2.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Variadero.
This includes State Road 104 between Mile Markers 51 and 59.
Up to 2.5 inches of rain fell in the warning area late Thursday, enabling rapid runoff to develop this evening.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Both localized and distant heavy rainfall will create sudden and dangerous flows in arroyos and over low water crossings.
